metadata.title: CVE-2019-9893 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libseccomp before 2.4.0 did not correctly generate 64-bit syscall argumentcomparisons using the arithmetic operators (LT, GT, LE, GE), which mightable to lead to bypassing seccomp filters and potential privilegeescalations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libseccomp2 - 2.4.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
seccomp - 2.4.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libseccomp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
